newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian shares boosted by bank merger news.
newsitem.headline: Estonian shares boosted by bank merger news.

text.p: News of Union Bank's merger plans sent the Estonian share market into a frenzy on Monday with most bank stocks gaining and activity high, dealers said.
The Tallinn stock exchange index leapt 6.53 percent to 177.78 and official list trade reached 50.8 million kroons.
Union Bank earlier announced that it was to merge with fifth largest bank North Estonian Bank to create what will be the second largest commercial bank in Estonia.
Union Bank rose to 48.5 kroons from 34.09 kroons on trade of 27.6 million kroons. It was also boosted by a report that the combined bank's 1997 profit would be 140 million kroons.
The bank later denied the report and said the forecast would only be made in February. It earlier announced that its 1996 profit was 57 million kroons.
"The new merged bank would increase its slice of the financial markets and its clients will be more confident about the bank," Hansapank analyst Katrin Kaarli said.
Other banks also gained, with Hansapank turning over 12.5 million kroons to close 5.30 kroons higher at 167 and Savings Bank up half a kroon to 76.50 on four million kroons of trade.
Forekspank rose 2.40 kroons at 126.80 kroons and turned over 3.6 million kroons.
The over-the-counter market traded 13 million kroons and the Rakevere meat plant was the most traded at six million kroons. It rose to 14.75 kroons from 11.30.
